intro: Eragrostis tenuiflora, commonly known as slender spikegrass, is a flowering plant native to various regions in Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant has slender, erect stems with small, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which bears tiny, two-lipped flowers. Eragrostis tenuiflora is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and ability to stabilize soil.
